item.dc:creator: Jayson Stark
item.title: MLB trade: Cliff Lee traded to Philadelphia Phillies by Cleveland Indians
item.description: The Phillies traded four prospects to the Indians for Cliff Lee.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Pujols' RBI single in 15th lifts Cards by Dodgers
item.description: Albert Pujols lined an RBI single over the head of center fielder Matt Kemp with two outs in the 15th inning, giving the St. Louis Cardinals a 3-2 victory over the Los Angeles Dodgers.

item.dc:creator: ESPN.com news services
item.title: Plaxico Burress, former New York Giants wide receiver, testifies before grand jury
item.description: Plaxico Burress testified in front of a grand jury for nearly three hours Wednesday about a 2008 weapons charge case in which the former Giants wide receiver shot himself in the leg.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Tampa Bay Rays pitcher Matt Garza plunked Mark Teixeira on purpose
item.description: Rays pitcher Matt Garza said he hit Mark Teixeira as payback for Evan Longoria getting plunked.

item.dc:creator: Jerry Crasnick
item.title: Pirates All-Star Freddy Sanchez traded to the Giants for prospect Tim Alderson
item.description: Pittsburgh second baseman Freddy Sanchez's status remained in limbo Wednesday as the San Francisco Giants' medical staff checked out his left knee for a second time as a prelude to a possible trade between the clubs, a source told ESPN.com.

item.dc:creator: Scott Burnside
item.title: Jim Balsillie's bid for Phoenix Coyotes unanimously rejected by NHL board of governors
item.description: Canadian businessman Jim Balsillie was unanimously rejected by the National Hockey League's board of governors in his bid to become an NHL owner at a meeting Wednesday afternoon in Chicago.

item.dc:creator: Buster Olney
item.title: MLB Trade: Toronto Blue Jays still not close to trading Roy Halladay
item.description: As the Phillies agreed to a deal for left-hander Cliff Lee, the Blue Jays were not close to a deal involving All-Star pitcher Roy Halladay.

item.dc:creator: External
item.title: MLS All-Stars lose on PKs to Everton

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Soriano jump-starts Cubs in rout against Astros
item.description: Randy Wells pitched eight shutout innings and Alfonso Soriano hit a three-run homer during a six-run first inning Wednesday, leading the Chicago Cubs to an 12-0 victory over the Houston Astros.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: John Daly gets own reality show to air on Golf Channel
item.description: John Daly says he hopes an upcoming reality show featuring him will provide a glimpse of his new-and-improved boring life.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Felipe Massa of Ferrari set to leave intensive care after taking first steps since crash
item.description: Ferrari's Felipe Massa will leave intensive care on Wednesday after taking his first steps since he fractured his skull in a crash at last weekend's Hungarian Grand Prix, the Formula One team said.

item.dc:creator: Associated Press
item.title: Phil Mickelson commits to PGA Championship
item.description: Phil Mickelson will play at next month's PGA Championship.
